command: [Net.ServicePointManager]::SecurityProtocol=[Net.SecurityProtocolType]::Tls12; $ts=Get-Date -Format o; try { $b=[Convert]::ToBase64String([Text.Encoding]::ASCII.GetBytes("$env:CENSYS_ID`:$env:CENSYS_SECRET")); $headers=@{ 'Authorization'="Basic $b"; 'Accept'='application/json' }; $body=@{ q='services.tls.certificates.leaf_data.subject_dn:contoso.com'; per_page=10 } | ConvertTo-Json; $r=Invoke-WebRequest -Uri 'https://search.censys.io/api/v2/hosts/search' -Method Post -Headers $headers -ContentType 'application/json' -Body $body -ErrorAction Stop; ($r.Content | ConvertFrom-Json | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 6) | Out-File -FilePath "$env:TEMP\censys_hosts_contoso.json" -Encoding utf8; Add-Content -Path "$env:TEMP\recon.log" -Value "$ts Censys success contoso.com" } catch { Add-Content -Path "$env:TEMP\recon.log" -Value "$ts Censys error: $($_.Exception.Message)" }
explanation: Posts an authenticated query to Censys Search v2 (account-gated) to retrieve host data referencing the target's certificate subject, limiting results to reduce noise and saving structured output.
rationale_steps: Authenticate using Basic token from environment variables.
Submit targeted query with pagination controls to a closed-source service.
Capture and persist structured JSON results.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed with balanced quotes, braces, and parentheses, proper error handling with try/catch, and correct use of PowerShell syntax for web requests, JSON conversion, and file operations.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with T1597 (Search Closed Sources) by authenticating to and querying Censys (a paid/gated intelligence source) to gather information about a target domain's TLS certificates, saving the results for later use in targeting.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is well-formed with balanced quotes/braces, valid hashtables and cmdlets, correct separators, and proper use of headers/body for Invoke-WebRequest.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It authenticates to the account-gated Censys API, executes a targeted host search by certificate subject, and saves structured results, which matches querying a closed-source database for reconnaissance under T1597.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed, using correct PowerShell syntax for variable assignments, command execution, error handling, and API interaction.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command flawlessly implements T1597 by performing an authenticated query against Censys, an account-gated internet intelligence platform, to gather specific host data (certificate subject) for target reconnaissance.
